page.title: 13Pubs and Inns
page.content:
THE SUN INN is on the northerly outskirts of Arlecdon.It is about 150 years old and is built of stone roughcast over.Inside the building is fairly traditional.It has not been fully modernised but during redecorating the plaster has been found to contain horse hair. It is owned by a local brewery "Matthew Brown" and the present tenant has been in residence for only the past three months.
THE PACK OF HOUNDS is on the main road near to Lamplugh.It too is a traditionally built structure and close to the site of the old iron ore mines.It also provided the focal point for the local Lamplugh Sports during the summer.
